relatedBlades.copy:
Does your SaaS security architecture protect against phishing, data loss, and shadow IT?

Protect your inbox and data with a Zero Trust approach

![A1 LP Banner - SaaS](//cf-assets.www.cloudflare.com/slt3lc6tev37/1Uql8sbRG07ZiGCSatGWct/8e2ebb4c2fa966a3e4746073152e6fb6/a1-gated-lp-banner.png) With the shift to the cloud and remote work, more organizations are turning to cloud email solutions within Microsoft 365 and Google Workspace — as much as 70% of organizations worldwide, per Gartner®. However, cloud email has also become one of the largest attack surfaces — attracting phishing, malware, spoofing, business email compromise (BEC), and other modern threats. A Zero Trust approach is the simple and scalable way to stay ahead of emerging threats, reduce phishing incidents, and improve efficiency. __Download this whitepaper to:__ - Review traditional vs. modern SaaS security - Learn how to combat new phishing categories while reducing email security complexity - Understand how Zero Trust simplifies user access to critical applications, and keeps your organization safe from both external and internal attacks - See how CASB + cloud email security optimally performs when implemented within a Zero Trust architecture
